findings.title: EmptyByteArrayCopy
findings.description: Copying an empty byte array (or string) from memory or calldata to storage can result in data corruption if the target array's length is increased subsequently without storing new data.

findings.title: DynamicArrayCleanup
findings.description: When assigning a dynamically-sized array with types of size at most 16 bytes in storage causing the assigned array to shrink, some parts of deleted slots were not zeroed out.

findings.title: Incorrect ERC20 implementation.
findings.description: The smart contract does not follow the correct ERC20 standard implementation.

findings.title: Outdated compiler version.
findings.description: Using outdated solidity compiler versions can lead to known bugs and vulnerabilities such as EmptyByteArrayCopy and DynamicArrayCleanup.

findings.title: No or floating compiler version set
findings.description: The solidity compiler version is not fixed or is floating, which can lead to compilation with an unsupported version and potential bugs.

findings.title: Use of right- to-left-override control character
findings.description: The contract uses a right-to-left-override control character which can lead to issues with code readability and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Shadowing of built-in symbol.
findings.description: The finding indicates that a custom variable or function is using the same name as a built-in Solidity symbol, which can lead to unexpected behavior and errors.

findings.title: Incorrect constructor name.
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: State variable shadows another state variable.
findings.description: This finding indicates a potential issue where a state variable is shadowing or overriding another state variable, which can lead to unintended behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Local variable shadows a state variable
findings.description: A local variable has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Function parameter shadows a state variable.
findings.description: The function parameter has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Named return value shadows a state variable
findings.description: A named return value shadows a state variable which can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Unary operation without effect
findings.description: The unary operation has no effect on the variable or expression in Solidity code analysis.

findings.title: Unary operation directly after assignment
findings.description: Performing a unary operation immediately after an assignment can lead to unintended behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unused state variable.
findings.description: The contract has a state variable that is declared but not used anywhere in the code.

findings.title: Unused local variable
findings.description: The code contains a locally declared variable that is not being utilized within the function.

findings.title: Function visibility is not set
findings.description: The function does not have its visibility explicitly set, which can lead to unintended access.

findings.title: State variable visibility is not set
findings.description: The visibility of a state variable has not been explicitly set.

findings.title: Use of deprecated functions: call code(), sha3(), …
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated functions such as call, code(), and sha3(). These functions are no longer supported and can cause security issues.

findings.title: Use of deprecated global variables (msg.gas, …)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated global variables such as msg.gas which can lead to compatibility issues and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Use of deprecated keywords (throw, var)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity keywords 'throw' and 'var', which can lead to compatibility issues and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Incorrect function state mutability
findings.description: The function's state mutability does not match its intended behavior, which can lead to unexpected changes or access to contract state.

findings.title: Does the code conform to the Solidity styleguide.
findings.description: The code does not follow the recommended coding standards and best practices outlined in the Solidity style guide.

findings.title: Timestamp Comparison
findings.description: The Burner constructor uses timestamp for comparisons.

findings.title: Division before Multiplication Vulnerability
findings.description: The getBurnAmount() function in Burner.sol performs a multiplication on the result of a division, which can lead to precision loss.

findings.title: External Function Declaration
findings.description: The owner() function should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: renounceOwnership() should be declared external:
findings.description: The renounceOwnership function should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: transferOwnership(address) should be declared external
findings.description: The function transferOwnership(address) should be declared as an external function.
